title: CVPR_2004_30_abs

sentences.text: Background modeling is an important component of many vision systems .
Existing work in the area has mostly addressed scenes that consist of static or quasi-static structures .
When the scene exhibits a persistent dynamic behavior in time , such an assumption is violated and detection performance deteriorates .
In this paper , we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes .
Towards the modeling of the dynamic characteristics , optical flow is computed and utilized as a feature in a higher dimensional space .
Inherent ambiguities in the computation of features are addressed by using a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels .
Extensive experiments demonstrate the utility and performance of the proposed approach .

Entity-we_propose_a_new_method_for_the_m.label: we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes
aliases: we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes
Entity-we_propose_a_new_method_for_the_m.description: A novel approach for processing dynamic visual scenes, enabling effective background modeling and detection performance.

Entity-the_proposed_approach.label: the proposed approach
Entity-the_proposed_approach.description: A new method for modeling and subtracting scenes that exhibit persistent dynamic behavior in time, utilizing optical flow as a feature in a higher dimensional space.

Entity-in_this_paper.label: In this paper
Entity-in_this_paper.description: This paper proposes a new method for background modeling and scene subtraction when dealing with persistent dynamic behavior in time.

Entity-a_a_feature_in_a_higher_dimension.label: as a feature in a higher dimensional space
aliases: as a feature in a higher dimensional space
Entity-a_a_feature_in_a_higher_dimension.description: Optical flow computed and used as a characteristic representation of dynamic scene behavior, projected onto a higher-dimensional space for modeling and analysis.

Entity-optical_flow_is_computed.label: optical flow is computed
Entity-optical_flow_is_computed.description: The process of calculating motion patterns or velocities between consecutive frames in an image sequence, used as a feature for modeling dynamic characteristics.

Entity-towards_the_modeling.label: Towards the modeling
Entity-towards_the_modeling.description: The process of developing methods for capturing and utilizing dynamic characteristics, specifically involving optical flow computation in higher-dimensional space.

Entity-the_computation_of_feature.label: the computation of features
Entity-the_computation_of_feature.description: The process of deriving and extracting relevant information from optical flow, used as a feature in a higher dimensional space to model dynamic characteristics.

Entity-optical_flow.label: optical flow
Entity-optical_flow.description: A technique used to measure the apparent motion of objects between consecutive frames in an image sequence, often employed in computer vision applications.

Entity-the_dynamic_characteristic.label: the dynamic characteristics
Entity-the_dynamic_characteristic.description: The dynamic characteristics refer to the persistent behavior of scenes over time, which exhibits changes and movements that need to be modeled and subtracted for accurate detection.

Entity-when_the_scene.label: When the scene
Entity-when_the_scene.description: A situation where the scene exhibits persistent dynamic behavior over time, violating assumptions and leading to deteriorated detection performance.

Entity-the_area.label: the area
Entity-the_area.description: The field of background modeling in computer vision, specifically addressing scenes with static or quasi-static structures.

Entity-background_modeling.label: Background modeling
Entity-background_modeling.description: The process or technique used to create a comprehensive representation of the background or environment, often for purposes such as object detection and segmentation.

Entity-data-dependent_bandwidth.label: data-dependent bandwidth
Entity-data-dependent_bandwidth.description: A technique used to address inherent ambiguities in feature computation, which involves adjusting the bandwidth of kernel-based density estimation based on input data.

Entity-a_data-dependent_bandwidth_for_de.label: a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels
aliases: a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels
Entity-a_data-dependent_bandwidth_for_de.description: A technique used to address inherent ambiguities in feature computation by dynamically adjusting the bandwidth of kernel-based density estimation methods.

mentions.local_name: a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels

Entity-persistent_dynamic_behavior_in_ti.label: persistent dynamic behavior in time
Entity-persistent_dynamic_behavior_in_ti.description: The phenomenon of scenes exhibiting continuous change or movement over time, violating assumptions made by traditional background modeling approaches.

Entity-such_an_assumption_is_violated.label: such an assumption is violated
Entity-such_an_assumption_is_violated.description: The assumption that scenes consist of static or quasi-static structures, which is typically made in background modeling.

Entity-detection_performance_deteriorate.label: detection performance deteriorates
Entity-detection_performance_deteriorate.description: The decline in accuracy of detecting objects or events due to persistent dynamic behavior in a scene over time.

Entity-scene_that_consist_of_static_or_q.description: Types of visual scenes characterized by unchanging or slowly changing structures, such as buildings or landscapes.

Entity-inherent_ambiguity.description: Ambiguities that arise from the inherent limitations or uncertainties in the process of computing visual features, such as optical flow.

summary: Background modeling is an important component of many vision systems . Existing work in the area has mostly addressed scenes that consist of static or quasi-static structures . When the scene exhibits a persistent dynamic behavior in time , such an assumption is violated and detection performance deteriorates . In this paper , we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes . Towards the modeling of the dynamic characteristics , optical flow is computed and utilized as a feature in a higher dimensional space . Inherent ambiguities in the computation of features are addressed by using a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels . Extensive experiments demonstrate the utility and performance of the proposed approach .

Predicate-is_an_important_component_of.label: is an important component of
Predicate-is_an_important_component_of.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) plays a crucial role or has significant relevance to another entity (the object). The connection suggests that the subject is an integral part of, contributes significantly to, or is essential for understanding the nature of the object. In general, this predicate highlights the importance and interconnectedness of the subject with respect to the object.

Predicate-has_addressed.label: has addressed
Predicate-has_addressed.description: The predicate 'has addressed' indicates that the subject (a person or entity) has provided a response, solution, or explanation to address a particular issue, problem, or concern represented by the object.

Predicate-has_mostly_addressed.label: has mostly addressed
Predicate-has_mostly_addressed.description: The predicate 'has mostly addressed' indicates a subject's primary focus on an object, suggesting that the majority of its attention, effort, or content has been directed towards it. This connection implies a significant relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject has devoted most of its resources to understanding, exploring, or describing the object.

Predicate-exhibits.label: exhibits
Predicate-exhibits.description: The predicate 'exhibits' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, 'the scene') displays or shows certain characteristics, properties, or behaviors that are described by the object. In general, it suggests a demonstration or manifestation of something inherent to the subject.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, approach, or plan. It implies presenting an idea or concept with the intention of considering it for implementation or adoption.

Predicate-modeling.label: modeling
Predicate-modeling.description: The predicate 'modeling' represents an act of creating or representing a conceptual framework that accurately reflects the characteristics or properties of its object. It implies a process of abstraction, simplification, and/or formalization to capture essential features of the object, making it easier to analyze, understand, communicate, or manipulate.

Predicate-computes.label: computes
Predicate-computes.description: Computes refers to a process of generating or deriving information from given data or inputs. It indicates that the subject (in this case, 'Towards the modeling') performs an operation on the object ('optical flow'), resulting in new knowledge, insights, or representations.

Predicate-utilized_as_a_feature_in.label: utilized as a feature in
Predicate-utilized_as_a_feature_in.description: The predicate 'utilized as a feature in' indicates that the subject (a process or computation) produces an outcome that is used as a characteristic or attribute within the context of the object, which can be a space, framework, system, or other structure. This connection highlights how the subject's output serves as a fundamental aspect or dimension within the larger scope defined by the object.

Predicate-have_inherent_ambiguities_in_t.label: have inherent ambiguities in the computation of
Predicate-have_inherent_ambiguities_in_t.description: This predicate indicates that there are underlying complexities or uncertainties present within a computational process related to its subject. The object represents the aspect being computed, which may be affected by these inherent ambiguities.

Predicate-propose_(1).label: propose
Predicate-propose_(1).description: To suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, plan, or idea for consideration and evaluation.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses a more general concept or category than the object. It suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject represents a specific instance or example of a larger class or domain defined by the object.
